00032 #ifndef CONTROLLER_INTERFACE_CONTROLLER_H
00033 #define CONTROLLER_INTERFACE_CONTROLLER_H
00034 
00035 
00036 #include <controller_interface/controller_base.h>
00037 #include <hardware_interface/robot_hw.h>
00038 #include <hardware_interface/hardware_interface.h>
00039 #include <ros/ros.h>
00040 
00041 
00042 namespace controller_interface
00043 {
00044 
00051 template <class T>
00052 class Controller: public ControllerBase
00053 {
00054 public:
00055   Controller()  {state_ = CONSTRUCTED;}
00056   virtual ~Controller<T>(){}
00057 
00071   virtual bool init(T* hw, ros::NodeHandle &n) = 0;
00072 
00073 
00074 protected:
00081   virtual bool initRequest(hardware_interface::RobotHW* robot_hw,
00082                            ros::NodeHandle &n,
00083                            std::set<std::string> &claimed_resources)
00084   {
00085     // check if construction finished cleanly
00086     if (state_ != CONSTRUCTED){
00087       ROS_ERROR("Cannot initialize this controller because it failed to be constructed");
00088       return false;
00089     }
00090 
00091     // get a pointer to the hardware interface
00092     T* hw = robot_hw->get<T>();
00093     if (!hw)
00094     {
00095       ROS_ERROR("This controller requires a hardware interface of type %s."
00096                 " Make sure this is registered in the hardware_interface::RobotHW class.", typeid(T).name());
00097       return false;
00098     }
00099 
00100     // return which resources are claimed by this controller
00101     hw->clearClaims();
00102     if (!init(hw, n))
00103     {
00104       ROS_ERROR("Failed to initialize the controller");
00105       return false;
00106     }
00107     claimed_resources = hw->getClaims();
00108     hw->clearClaims();
00109 
00110     // success
00111     state_ = INITIALIZED;
00112     return true;
00113   }
00114 
00115   virtual std::string getHardwareInterfaceType() const
00116   {
00117     return typeid(T).name();
00118   }
00119 
00120 private:
00121   Controller<T>(const Controller<T> &c);
00122   Controller<T>& operator =(const Controller<T> &c);
00123 
00124 };
00125 
00126 }
00127 
00128 #endif
